title: Company storefront category cleanup and publish-ready frontend wiring

requirements.summary: Remove NFT/crypto-related fallback UI data and align the frontend fallback storefront categories (ids/titles/descriptions) to the physical-goods category set in English.
acceptanceCriteria: The homepage does not show an “NFTs” category in fallback mode
Fallback categories match the backend category set and ids used by the product listing/category filtering UI

file_operations.description: Update `defaultConfig` to include exactly 8 physical store categories (Women’s Clothing, Men’s Clothing, Children’s Clothing, Infant Clothing, Shoes, Jewelry, Accessories, Bags) with stable kebab-case ids matching the backend (e.g., `womens-clothing`, `mens-clothing`, `childrens-clothing`, `infant-clothing`, `shoes`, `jewelry`, `accessories`, `bags`), and remove any NFT/crypto (and other unsupported) fallback categories. Ensure all fallback titles/descriptions remain English. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Remove NFT/crypto-related icon/gradient mappings and add mappings for the updated category ids (including Accessories and Bags) so fallback mode and backend-driven mode render consistent category cards without “NFTs”. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust the ProductsSection initial selected category fallback (currently hardcoded to `men`) to use the updated category ids (prefer first category from props, otherwise default to `womens-clothing`) so category filtering works when backend config is unavailable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure the frontend is publish-ready and supports end-to-end browsing, cart, and checkout with the updated category ids and navigation wiring.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean build succeeds for both frontend and backend
The published deployment loads without runtime errors
A user can: open the storefront, browse categories, add an in-stock product to cart, submit checkout, and receive an order confirmation with an order id

file_operations.description: Add robust navigation wiring so clicking a category (from header/footer/showcase) reliably scrolls to the products area and selects the corresponding category tab. Implement a lightweight hash-based or shared-state mechanism that maps category ids to `selectedCategory` and keeps the UI in sync (including on initial load when a hash is present). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update category click behavior to navigate users to the products browsing experience (rather than scrolling to the category card itself). Integrate with the ProductsSection category-selection mechanism (e.g., set location hash and scroll to `products`). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure header category navigation items work with the updated category ids and trigger the same products-section selection behavior used elsewhere (including on mobile menu). Keep user-facing labels in English. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure footer category shortcuts use the updated category ids and trigger the shared products-section navigation/selection behavior so category browsing works consistently across the app. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Harden checkout UX for publish readiness: preserve and display the returned order id on success (current behavior) and ensure failures are handled without runtime errors (e.g., show an English error toast/message and keep cart items intact when an order fails). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
